content: or until cap sits one round single_crochet depth above the ears as pictured ch1 half_double_crochet into the back loop only of each st around join 44sts round 10 work entire round into the back loops only ch2 not a st double_crochet into each of the first 8sts single_crochet into each of the next 5sts goes over ear double_crochet into each of the next 18sts single_crochet into each of the next 5sts for other ear double_crochet into each of the remaining 8sts 44sts fasten_off leaving a long tail to make the gather and sew cap to dolls head using a darning needle use tail to weave in and out up the last 4 rounds pull to gather then use the needle wrap the yarn around the gather several times until you are happy with how it looks sew cap to head using a whip st in desired way and then hide any loose ends i have a video showing how to gather a cap for the parting here advice for hair caps… help my hair cap is too small if you find that the cap is too snug you can pull back your work to round 4 44sts and work an extra increase round to increase the cap by 10 stitches so round 5 would be ch1 double_crochet in each of the first three sts *2dc in next st double_crochet in each of the next three sts repeat from * around ending with 2dc in last st join 55sts then you would just adjust the amount of straight rounds accordingly rounds 5-7 as written until the cap fits one double_crochet round above the ears then work round 8 as written alternatively you can try working the cap in a bigger hook size help my hair cap is too big if you find that the cap is a bit too roomy you can pull back your work to round 3 33sts and repeat the straight rounds from there as necessary to reduce the cap by 10 stitches you will of course need to adjust the last round which shapes around the ears as appropriate alternatively you can try reworking the cap in a smaller hook size pigtails make 2 *leaving a long tail ch13 work 2hdc into the second chain from hook work 2hdc into each of the next 7chs half_double_crochet into each of the remaining 4chs repeat from * three more times 4 curls total fasten_off leaving a long tail tips for tighter curls work 3hdc into each chain rather than 2 or try using a smaller hook for thinner curls use single_crochet rather than half_double_crochet or for thicker use dcs attach a darning needle to the long fastening off tail and weave it in and out along the top of the curls as pictured then pull tight to gather attach a needle to both the long starting tail and finishing tail together and sew the pigtails onto the head where
